DataElement.preferredName: Patient Sufficient Hematologic Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator as to whether the patient meets eligibility criteria for adequate hematological function.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Sufficient Hematologic Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._The normal action performed by a structure or device._In clinical trials, requirements that must be met for a person to be included in a trial. These requirements help make sure that participants in a trial are like each other in terms of specific factors such as age, type and stage of cancer, general health, and previous treatment. When all participants meet the same eligibility criteria, it is more likely that results of the study are caused by the intervention being tested and not by other factors or by chance.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Sufficient Hematologic Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation.:Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.:The normal action performed by a structure or device.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement; enough to meet the needs of a situation.
Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
